title: How to write a thank you letter interview - Quora

response.answer_text: Something like this, but utilize your own words. Thank you for taking the time to talk with me, about xxxx position. I enjoyed meeting you. Then you should make some comments about the company, like I like your office set up. Your service product is exciting. Your company certainly has a excellent business record with the Better Business Bureau. You want to give positive marks about what you heard and saw. There are a couple of reasons for this. First you want to show you are excited for the position. Second, anything you can say about the company's purpose showsyou were paying attention and even better, have looked up information about that company. Like I had no idea you started your business in 2001. That is quite an accomplishment. Anything you can mention to remind your interviewer of who you were, is a good idea. That way you are in their mind and connect the letter to your person. Positive things only. Like I enjoyed talking with you about xxx. Your information has inspired me to increase my knowledge about xxx. Your last statements should be reiterating how you can help the company and be a good fit. How you can be an asset to them basically. And lastly, I am excited or whatever word to hear back from you. I have kind of smushed the information you want, in the letter, but I think you can get the idea. Oh, be sure and get your info, in the top right of the letter. Include phone and e-mail as well as address. You might find some good examples online. I know a thank you letter has helped me gain good employment. Many applicants do not bother and how is the interview person to remember who is who. Good Luck!
